title.text: RFC 6195: Domain Name System (DNS) IANA Considerations

contents.text:
Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF)                   D. Eastlake 3rd
Request for Comments: 6195                                        Huawei
BCP: 42                                                       March 2011
Obsoletes: 5395
Updates: 1183, 3597
Category: Best Current Practice
ISSN: 2070-1721
Domain Name System (DNS) IANA Considerations
contents.zh-CHS: 域名系统（DNS）IANA注意事项

contents.text: Abstract
contents.zh-CHS: 摘要

contents.text: This document specifies Internet Assigned Number Authority (IANA) parameter assignment considerations for the allocation of Domain Name System (DNS) resource record types, CLASSes, operation codes, error codes, DNS protocol message header bits, and AFSDB resource record subtypes.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档规定了分配域名系统（DNS）资源记录类型、类、操作代码、错误代码、DNS协议消息头位和AFSDB资源记录子类型时的Internet分配号码管理局（IANA）参数分配注意事项。

contents.text: Status of This Memo
contents.zh-CHS: 关于下段备忘

contents.text: This memo documents an Internet Best Current Practice.
contents.zh-CHS: 本备忘录记录了互联网最佳实践。

contents.text: This document is a product of the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF). It represents the consensus of the IETF community. It has received public review and has been approved for publication by the Internet Engineering Steering Group (IESG). Further information on BCPs is available in Section 2 of RFC 5741.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件是互联网工程任务组（IETF）的产品。它代表了IETF社区的共识。它已经接受了公众审查，并已被互联网工程指导小组（IESG）批准出版。有关BCP的更多信息，请参见RFC 5741第2节。

contents.text: Information about the current status of this document, any errata, and how to provide feedback on it may be obtained at http://www.rfc-editor.org/info/rfc6195.
contents.zh-CHS: 有关本文件当前状态、任何勘误表以及如何提供反馈的信息，请访问http://www.rfc-editor.org/info/rfc6195.

contents.text: Copyright Notice
contents.zh-CHS: 版权公告

contents.zh-CHS: 版权所有（c）2011 IETF信托基金和确定为文件作者的人员。版权所有。

Please review these documents carefully, as they describe your rights and restrictions with respect to this document. Code Components extracted from this document must include Simplified BSD License text as described in Section 4.e of the Trust Legal Provisions and are provided without warranty as described in the Simplified BSD License.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件受BCP 78和IETF信托有关IETF文件的法律规定的约束(http://trustee.ietf.org/license-info)自本文件出版之日起生效。请仔细阅读这些文件，因为它们描述了您对本文件的权利和限制。从本文件中提取的代码组件必须包括信托法律条款第4.e节中所述的简化BSD许可证文本，并提供简化BSD许可证中所述的无担保。

contents.text: Table of Contents
contents.zh-CHS: 目录

contents.text: 1. Introduction
contents.zh-CHS: 1. 介绍

contents.text: The Domain Name System (DNS) provides replicated distributed secure hierarchical databases that store "resource records" (RRs) under domain names. DNS data is structured into CLASSes and zones that can be independently maintained. Familiarity with [RFC1034], [RFC1035], [RFC2136], [RFC2181], and [RFC4033] is assumed.
contents.zh-CHS: 域名系统（DNS）提供复制的分布式安全分层数据库，在域名下存储“资源记录”（RRs）。DNS数据被构造成可以独立维护的类和区域。假设熟悉[RFC1034]、[RFC1035]、[RFC2136]、[RFC2181]和[RFC4033]。

contents.text: This document provides, either directly or by reference, the general IANA parameter assignment considerations that apply across DNS query and response headers and all RRs. There may be additional IANA considerations that apply to only a particular RRTYPE or query/response OpCode. See the specific RFC defining that RRTYPE or query/response OpCode for such considerations if they have been defined, except for AFSDB RR considerations [RFC1183], which are included herein. This RFC obsoletes [RFC5395]; however, the only significant change is the change to the public review mailing list to dnsext@ietf.org.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档直接或通过引用提供了适用于DNS查询和响应头以及所有RRs的一般IANA参数分配注意事项。可能存在仅适用于特定RRTYPE或查询/响应操作码的其他IANA注意事项。如果已经定义了这些注意事项，请参见定义RRTYPE或查询/响应操作码的特定RFC，此处包括的AFSDB RR注意事项[RFC1183]除外。该RFC淘汰了[RFC5395]；然而，唯一的重大变化是将公共评论邮件列表更改为dnsext@ietf.org.

contents.text: IANA currently maintains a web page of DNS parameters available from http://www.iana.org.
contents.zh-CHS: IANA目前维护的DNS参数网页可从http://www.iana.org.

contents.text: 1.1. Terminology
"Standards Action", "IETF Review", "Specification Required", and "Private Use" are as defined in [RFC5226].
contents.zh-CHS: “标准行动”、“IETF审查”、“所需规范”和“私人使用”的定义见[RFC5226]。

contents.text: 2. DNS Query/Response Headers
contents.zh-CHS: 2. DNS查询/响应头

contents.text: The header for DNS queries and responses contains field/bits in the following diagram taken from [RFC2136] and [RFC5395]:
contents.zh-CHS: DNS查询和响应的标题包含取自[RFC2136]和[RFC5395]的下图中的字段/位：

contents.text: The ID field identifies the query and is echoed in the response so they can be matched.
contents.zh-CHS: ID字段标识查询，并在响应中回送，以便匹配。

contents.text: The QR bit indicates whether the header is for a query or a response.
contents.zh-CHS: QR位指示标头是用于查询还是用于响应。

contents.text: The AA, TC, RD, RA, AD, and CD bits are each theoretically meaningful only in queries or only in responses, depending on the bit. However, some DNS implementations copy the query header as the initial value of the response header without clearing bits. Thus, any attempt to use a "query" bit with a different meaning in a response or to define a query meaning for a "response" bit is dangerous, given existing implementation. Such meanings may only be assigned by a Standards Action.
contents.zh-CHS: AA、TC、RD、RA、AD和CD位仅在查询中或仅在响应中具有理论意义，具体取决于位。但是，一些DNS实现将查询标头复制为响应标头的初始值，而不清除位。因此，考虑到现有的实现，任何试图在响应中使用具有不同含义的“查询”位或为“响应”位定义查询含义的尝试都是危险的。此类含义只能由标准行动赋予。

contents.text: The unsigned integer fields query count (QDCOUNT), answer count (ANCOUNT), authority count (NSCOUNT), and additional information count (ARCOUNT) express the number of records in each section for all OpCodes except Update [RFC2136]. These fields have the same structure and data type for Update but are instead the counts for the zone (ZOCOUNT), prerequisite (PRCOUNT), update (UPCOUNT), and additional information (ARCOUNT) sections.
contents.zh-CHS: 无符号整数字段query count（QDCOUNT）、answer count（ANCOUNT）、authority count（NSCOUNT）和additional information count（ARCOUNT）表示除Update[RFC2136]之外的所有操作码的每个部分中的记录数。这些字段具有相同的更新结构和数据类型，但它们是区域（ZOCOUNT）、前提条件（PRCOUNT）、更新（UPCOUNT）和附加信息（ARCOUNT）部分的计数。

contents.text: 2.1. One Spare Bit?
contents.zh-CHS: 2.1. 一点多余的？

contents.text: There have been ancient DNS implementations for which the Z bit being on in a query meant that only a response from the primary server for a zone is acceptable. It is believed that current DNS implementations ignore this bit.
contents.zh-CHS: 有一些古老的DNS实现，对于这些实现，查询中的Z位为on意味着只能接受来自主服务器的区域响应。据信，当前的DNS实现忽略了此位。

contents.text: Assigning a meaning to the Z bit requires a Standards Action.
contents.zh-CHS: 为Z位赋值需要标准操作。

contents.text: 2.2. OpCode Assignment
contents.zh-CHS: 2.2. 操作码分配

contents.text: Currently, DNS OpCodes are assigned as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 目前，DNS操作码分配如下：

contents.text: OpCode Name Reference
contents.zh-CHS: 操作码名称引用

contents.text:
0     Query                             [RFC1035]
 1     IQuery  (Inverse Query, Obsolete) [RFC3425]
 2     Status                            [RFC1035]
 3     available for assignment
 4     Notify                            [RFC1996]
 5     Update                            [RFC2136]
6-15   available for assignment
New OpCode assignments require a Standards Action as modified by [RFC4020].
contents.zh-CHS: 新的操作码分配需要[RFC4020]修改的标准操作。

contents.text: 2.3. RCODE Assignment
contents.zh-CHS: 2.3. RCODE分配

contents.text: It would appear from the DNS header above that only four bits of RCODE, or response/error code, are available. However, RCODEs can appear not only at the top level of a DNS response but also inside OPT RRs [RFC2671], TSIG RRs [RFC2845], and TKEY RRs [RFC2930]. The OPT RR provides an 8-bit extension resulting in a 12-bit RCODE field, and the TSIG and TKEY RRs have a 16-bit RCODE field.
contents.zh-CHS: 从上面的DNS头可以看出，只有四位RCODE或响应/错误代码可用。但是，RCODE不仅可以出现在DNS响应的顶层，还可以出现在OPT RRs[RFC2671]、TSIG RRs[RFC2845]和TKEY RRs[RFC2930]内部。OPT RR提供8位扩展，产生12位RCODE字段，TSIG和TKEY RRs具有16位RCODE字段。

contents.text: Error codes appearing in the DNS header and in these three RR types all refer to the same error code space with the single exception of error code 16, which has a different meaning in the OPT RR than in other contexts. This duplicate assignment was accidental. See table below.
contents.zh-CHS: 出现在DNS报头和这三种RR类型中的错误代码均指相同的错误代码空间，唯一的例外是错误代码16，它在OPT RR中的含义与在其他上下文中的含义不同。这个重复的任务是偶然的。见下表。

contents.text:
RCODE   Name    Description                        Reference
    Decimal
      Hexadecimal
     0    NoError   No Error                           [RFC1035]
     1    FormErr   Format Error                       [RFC1035]
     2    ServFail  Server Failure                     [RFC1035]
     3    NXDomain  Non-Existent Domain                [RFC1035]
     4    NotImp    Not Implemented                    [RFC1035]
     5    Refused   Query Refused                      [RFC1035]
     6    YXDomain  Name Exists when it should not     [RFC2136]
     7    YXRRSet   RR Set Exists when it should not   [RFC2136]
     8    NXRRSet   RR Set that should exist does not  [RFC2136]
     9    NotAuth   Server Not Authoritative for zone  [RFC2136]
    10    NotZone   Name not contained in zone         [RFC2136]
    11 - 15         Available for assignment
    16    BADVERS   Bad OPT Version                    [RFC2671]
    16    BADSIG    TSIG Signature Failure             [RFC2845]
    17    BADKEY    Key not recognized                 [RFC2845]
    18    BADTIME   Signature out of time window       [RFC2845]
    19    BADMODE   Bad TKEY Mode                      [RFC2930]
    20    BADNAME   Duplicate key name                 [RFC2930]
    21    BADALG    Algorithm not supported            [RFC2930]
    22    BADTRUC   Bad Truncation                     [RFC4635]
    23 - 3,840
0x0017 - 0x0F00     Available for assignment
3,841 - 4,095 0x0F01 - 0x0FFF Private Use
4,096 - 65,534 0x1000 - 0xFFFE Available for assignment
65,535 0xFFFF Reserved, can only be allocated by a Standards Action.
contents.zh-CHS: 65535 0xFFFF保留，只能由标准操作分配。

contents.text: Since it is important that RCODEs be understood for interoperability, assignment of a new RCODE in the ranges listed above as "Available for assignment" requires an IETF Review.
contents.zh-CHS: 由于理解RCODE的互操作性非常重要，因此在上述“可供分配”范围内分配新RCODE需要IETF审查。

contents.text: 3. DNS Resource Records
contents.zh-CHS: 3. DNS资源记录

contents.text: All RRs have the same top-level format, shown in the figure below taken from [RFC1035].
contents.zh-CHS: 所有RRs具有相同的顶级格式，如下图所示，摘自[RFC1035]。

contents.text: NAME is an owner name, i.e., the name of the node to which this resource record pertains. NAMEs are specific to a CLASS as described in Section 3.2. NAMEs consist of an ordered sequence of one or more labels, each of which has a label type [RFC1035] [RFC2671].
contents.zh-CHS: NAME是所有者名称，即此资源记录所属节点的名称。如第3.2节所述，名称是特定于类的。名称由一个或多个标签的有序序列组成，每个标签都有一个标签类型[RFC1035][RFC2671]。

contents.text: TYPE is a 2-octet unsigned integer containing one of the RRTYPE codes. See Section 3.1.
contents.zh-CHS: 类型是包含一个RRTYPE代码的2个八位无符号整数。见第3.1节。

contents.text: CLASS is a 2-octet unsigned integer containing one of the RR CLASS codes. See Section 3.2.
contents.zh-CHS: 类是包含一个RR类代码的2个八位无符号整数。见第3.2节。

contents.text: TTL is a 4-octet (32-bit) unsigned integer that specifies, for data TYPEs, the number of seconds that the resource record may be cached before the source of the information should again be consulted. Zero is interpreted to mean that the RR can only be used for the transaction in progress.
contents.zh-CHS: TTL是一个4-octet（32位）无符号整数，对于数据类型，它指定在再次查询信息源之前可以缓存资源记录的秒数。零被解释为意味着RR只能用于正在进行的事务。

contents.text: RDLENGTH is an unsigned 16-bit integer that specifies the length in octets of the RDATA field.
contents.zh-CHS: RDLENGTH是一个无符号16位整数，指定RDATA字段的长度（以八位字节为单位）。

contents.text: RDATA is a variable-length string of octets that constitutes the resource. The format of this information varies according to the TYPE and, in some cases, the CLASS of the resource record.
contents.zh-CHS: RDATA是组成资源的可变长度八位字节字符串。此信息的格式根据资源记录的类型以及在某些情况下的类别而有所不同。

contents.text: 3.1. RRTYPE IANA Considerations
contents.zh-CHS: 3.1. RRA类型注意事项

contents.text: There are three subcategories of RRTYPE numbers: data TYPEs, QTYPEs, and Meta-TYPEs.
contents.zh-CHS: RRTYPE编号有三个子类别：数据类型、QTYPE和元类型。

contents.text: Data TYPEs are the means of storing data. QTYPES can only be used in queries. Meta-TYPEs designate transient data associated with a particular DNS message and, in some cases, can also be used in queries. Thus far, data TYPEs have been assigned from 1 upward, plus the block from 100 through 103, and from 32,768 upward, while Q and Meta-TYPEs have been assigned from 255 downward except for the OPT Meta-RR, which is assigned TYPE 41. There have been DNS implementations that made caching decisions based on the top bit of the bottom byte of the RRTYPE.
contents.zh-CHS: 数据类型是存储数据的手段。QTYPES只能在查询中使用。元类型指定与特定DNS消息关联的瞬态数据，在某些情况下，还可以在查询中使用。到目前为止，数据类型是从1向上分配的，加上从100到103的块，以及从32768向上分配的，而Q和元类型是从255向下分配的，除了OPT Meta RR，它被分配为类型41。有一些DNS实现基于RRTYPE的底部字节的顶部位做出缓存决策。

contents.text: There are currently three Meta-TYPEs assigned: OPT [RFC2671], TSIG [RFC2845], and TKEY [RFC2930]. There are currently five QTYPEs assigned: * (ALL), MAILA, MAILB, AXFR, and IXFR.
contents.zh-CHS: 目前分配了三种元类型：OPT[RFC2671]、TSIG[RFC2845]和TKEY[RFC2930]。目前分配了五个QType:*（全部）、MAILA、MAILB、AXFR和IXFR。

contents.text: RRTYPEs have mnemonics that must be completely disjoint from the mnemonics used for CLASSes and that must match the following regular expression:
contents.zh-CHS: RRTYPE的助记符必须与用于类的助记符完全分离，并且必须与以下正则表达式匹配：

contents.text: Considerations for the allocation of new RRTYPEs are as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 分配新RRT类型的注意事项如下：

contents.text: Decimal Hexadecimal
contents.zh-CHS: 十六进制

contents.text: 0 0x0000 - RRTYPE zero is used as a special indicator for the SIG (0) RR [RFC2931] [RFC4034] and in other circumstances, and it must never be allocated for ordinary use.
contents.zh-CHS: 0 0x0000-RRTYPE zero用作SIG（0）RR[RFC2931][RFC4034]和其他情况下的特殊指示器，且不得分配用于普通用途。

contents.text: 1 - 127 0x0001 - 0x007F - Remaining RRTYPEs in this range are assigned for data TYPEs by the DNS RRTYPE Allocation Policy as specified in Section 3.1.1.
contents.zh-CHS: 1-127 0x0001-0x007F-此范围内的剩余RRTYPE由DNS RRTYPE分配策略分配给数据类型，如第3.1.1节所述。

contents.text: 128 - 255 0x0080 - 0x00FF - Remaining RRTYPEs in this range are assigned for Q and Meta-TYPEs by the DNS RRTYPE Allocation Policy as specified in Section 3.1.1.
contents.zh-CHS: 128-255 0x0080-0x00FF-此范围内的剩余RRTYPE由DNS RRTYPE分配策略分配给Q和元类型，如第3.1.1节所述。

contents.text: 256 - 61,439 0x0100 - 0xEFFF - Remaining RRTYPEs in this range are assigned for data RRTYPEs by the DNS RRTYPE Allocation Policy as specified in Section 3.1.1. (32,768 and 32,769 (0x8000 and 0x8001) have been assigned.)
contents.zh-CHS: 256-61439 0x0100-0xEFFF-此范围内的剩余RRTYPE由DNS RRTYPE分配策略分配给数据RRTYPE，如第3.1.1节所述。（已分配32768和32769（0x8000和0x8001）

contents.text: 61,440 - 65,279 0xF000 - 0xFEFF - Reserved for future use. IETF Review required to define use.
contents.zh-CHS: 61440-65279 0xF000-0xFEFF-保留供将来使用。定义使用所需的IETF评审。

contents.text: 65,280 - 65,534 0xFF00 - 0xFFFE - Private Use.
contents.zh-CHS: 65280-65534 0xFF00-0xFFFE-私人使用。

contents.text: 65,535 0xFFFF - Reserved, can only be assigned by a Standards Action.
contents.zh-CHS: 65535 0xFFFF-保留，只能由标准操作分配。

contents.text: 3.1.1. DNS RRTYPE Allocation Policy
contents.zh-CHS: 3.1.1. DNS类型分配策略

contents.text: Parameter values specified in Section 3.1 above, as assigned based on DNS RRTYPE Allocation Policy, are allocated by Expert Review if they meet the two requirements listed below. There will be a pool of a small number of Experts appointed by the IESG. Each application will be ruled on by an Expert selected by IANA. In any case where the selected Expert is unavailable or states they have a conflict of interest, IANA may select another Expert from the pool.
contents.zh-CHS: 根据DNS RRTYPE分配策略分配的上述第3.1节中规定的参数值，如果满足以下两个要求，则由专家评审进行分配。IESG将任命少量专家。每项申请将由IANA选定的专家裁决。在任何情况下，如果选定的专家不可用或表示他们存在利益冲突，IANA可以从人才库中选择另一位专家。

contents.text: Some guidelines for the Experts are given in Section 3.1.2. RRTYPEs that do not meet the requirements below may nonetheless be allocated by a Standards Action as modified by [RFC4020].
contents.zh-CHS: 第3.1.2节给出了一些专家指南。不符合以下要求的RRT类型仍可通过[RFC4020]修改的标准行动进行分配。

contents.text: 1. A complete template as specified in Appendix A has been posted for three weeks to the dnsext@ietf.org mailing list before the Expert Review decision.
contents.zh-CHS: 1. 附录A中规定的完整模板已张贴至dnsext@ietf.org专家评审决定前的邮件列表。

contents.text: Note that partially completed or draft templates may be posted directly by the applicant for comment and discussion, but the formal posting to start the three-week period is made by the Expert.
contents.zh-CHS: 请注意，部分完成的模板或模板草案可由申请人直接发布以供评论和讨论，但正式发布以开始为期三周的时间是由专家进行的。

contents.text: 2. The RR for which an RRTYPE code is being requested is either (a) a data TYPE that can be handled as an Unknown RR as described in [RFC3597] or (b) a Meta-TYPE whose processing is optional, i.e., it is safe to simply discard RRs with that Meta-TYPE in queries or responses.
contents.zh-CHS: 2. 请求RRTYPE代码的RR是（a）可作为[RFC3597]中所述的未知RR处理的数据类型，或（b）其处理是可选的元类型，即，在查询或响应中简单地丢弃带有该元类型的RRs是安全的。

contents.text: Note that such RRs may include additional section processing, provided such processing is optional.
contents.zh-CHS: 注意，如果这样的处理是可选的，那么这样的RRs可以包括额外的部分处理。

contents.text: After the applicant posts their formal application with their template as specified in Appendix A, IANA appoints an Expert and the template is posted, with an indication that it is a formal application, to the dnsext@ietf.org mailing list. No less than three weeks and no more than six weeks after this posting to dnsext@ietf.org, the selected Expert shall post a message, explicitly accepting or rejecting the application, to IANA, dnsext@ietf.org, and the email address provided by the applicant. If the Expert does not post such a message, the application shall be considered rejected but may be resubmitted to IANA. IANA should report non-responsive Experts to the IESG.
contents.zh-CHS: 申请人按照附录A中规定的模板发布其正式申请后，IANA任命一名专家，并将模板发布到dnsext@ietf.org邮件列表。在本次发布后不少于三周且不超过六周dnsext@ietf.org，选定的专家应向IANA发布消息，明确接受或拒绝申请，dnsext@ietf.org，以及申请人提供的电子邮件地址。如果专家未发布此类信息，则该申请将被视为被拒绝，但可重新提交给IANA。IANA应向IESG报告非响应专家。

contents.text: IANA shall maintain a public archive of approved templates.
contents.zh-CHS: IANA应保存批准模板的公共档案。

contents.text: 3.1.2. DNS RRTYPE Expert Guidelines
contents.zh-CHS: 3.1.2. DNS类型专家指南

contents.text: The selected DNS RRTYPE Expert is required to monitor discussion of the proposed RRTYPE, which may occur on the dnsext@ietf.org mailing list, and may consult with other technical experts as necessary. The Expert should normally reject any RRTYPE allocation request that meets one or more of the following criteria:
contents.zh-CHS: 所选DNS RRTYPE专家需要监控对建议RRTYPE的讨论，这可能发生在dnsext@ietf.org邮件列表，必要时可咨询其他技术专家。专家通常应拒绝满足以下一个或多个标准的任何RRTYPE分配请求：

contents.text: 1. Was documented in a manner that was not sufficiently clear to evaluate or implement.
contents.zh-CHS: 1. 记录的方式不够清晰，无法进行评估或实施。

contents.text: 2. The proposed RRTYPE or RRTYPEs affect DNS processing and do not meet the criteria in point 2 of Section 3.1.1 above.
contents.zh-CHS: 2. 建议的RRTYPE或RRTYPE会影响DNS处理，且不符合上述第3.1.1节第2点中的标准。

contents.text: 3. The documentation of the proposed RRTYPE or RRTYPEs is incomplete. (Additional documentation can be provided during the public comment period or by the Expert.)
contents.zh-CHS: 3. 拟议RRTYPE或RRTYPE的文件不完整。（其他文件可在公众评论期间或由专家提供。）

contents.text: 4. Application use as documented makes incorrect assumptions about DNS protocol behavior, such as wild cards, CNAME, DNAME, etc.
contents.zh-CHS: 4. 有文档记录的应用程序使用对DNS协议行为（如通配符、CNAME、DNAME等）做出了错误的假设。

contents.text: 5. An excessive number of RRTYPE values is being requested when the purpose could be met with a smaller number or with Private Use values.
contents.zh-CHS: 5. 当使用较小的值或专用值可以满足目的时，请求的RRTYPE值过多。

contents.text: 3.1.3. Special Note on the OPT RR
contents.zh-CHS: 3.1.3. 关于OPT RR的特别说明

contents.text: The OPT (OPTion) RR (RRTYPE 41) and its IANA considerations are specified in [RFC2671]. Its primary purpose is to extend the effective field size of various DNS fields including RCODE, label type, OpCode, flag bits, and RDATA size. In particular, for resolvers and servers that recognize it, it extends the RCODE field from 4 to 12 bits.
contents.zh-CHS: [RFC2671]中规定了OPT（OPTion）RR（RRTYPE 41）及其IANA注意事项。其主要目的是扩展各种DNS字段的有效字段大小，包括RCODE、标签类型、操作码、标志位和RDATA大小。特别是，对于识别RCODE的解析器和服务器，它将RCODE字段从4位扩展到12位。

contents.text: 3.1.4. The AFSDB RR Subtype Field
contents.zh-CHS: 3.1.4. AFSDB RR子类型字段

contents.text: The AFSDB RR [RFC1183] is a CLASS-insensitive RR that has the same RDATA field structure as the MX RR [RFC1035], but the 16-bit unsigned integer field at the beginning of the RDATA is interpreted as a subtype as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: AFSDB RR[RFC1183]是一种不区分类的RR，它与MX RR[RFC1035]具有相同的RDATA字段结构，但RDATA开头的16位无符号整数字段被解释为如下子类型：

contents.text: Decimal Hexadecimal
contents.zh-CHS: 十六进制

contents.text: 0 0x0000 - Reserved; allocation requires a Standards Action.
contents.zh-CHS: 0 0x0000-保留；分配需要标准操作。

contents.text: 1 0x0001 - Andrews File Service v3.0 Location Service [RFC1183].
contents.zh-CHS: 1 0x0001-Andrews文件服务v3.0位置服务[RFC1183]。

contents.text: 2 0x0002 - DCE/NCA root cell directory node [RFC1183].
contents.zh-CHS: 2 0x0002-DCE/NCA根单元目录节点[RFC1183]。

contents.text: 3 - 65,279 0x0003 - 0xFEFF - Allocation by IETF Review.
contents.zh-CHS: 3-65279 0x0003-0xFEFF-由IETF评审分配。

contents.text: 65,280 - 65,534 0xFF00 - 0xFFFE - Private Use.
contents.zh-CHS: 65280-65534 0xFF00-0xFFFE-私人使用。

contents.text: 65,535 0xFFFF - Reserved; allocation requires a Standards Action.
contents.zh-CHS: 65535 0xFFFF-预留；分配需要标准操作。

contents.text: 3.2. RR CLASS IANA Considerations
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2. RR类IANA注意事项

contents.text: There are currently two subcategories of DNS CLASSes: normal, data-containing classes and QCLASSes that are only meaningful in queries or updates.
contents.zh-CHS: DNS类目前有两个子类：普通类、包含数据的类和仅在查询或更新中有意义的QClass。

contents.text: DNS CLASSes have been little used but constitute another dimension of the DNS distributed database. In particular, there is no necessary relationship between the name space or root servers for one data CLASS and those for another data CLASS. The same DNS NAME can have completely different meanings in different CLASSes. The label types are the same, and the null label is usable only as root in every CLASS. As global networking and DNS have evolved, the IN, or Internet, CLASS has dominated DNS use.
contents.zh-CHS: DNS类很少使用，但构成了DNS分布式数据库的另一个维度。特别是，一个数据类的名称空间或根服务器与另一个数据类的名称空间或根服务器之间没有必要的关系。相同的DNS名称在不同的类中可能具有完全不同的含义。标签类型是相同的，空标签只能作为每个类中的根使用。随着全球网络和DNS的发展，IN或Internet类已经主导了DNS的使用。

contents.text: As yet, there has not been a requirement for "meta-CLASSes". That would be a CLASS to designate transient data associated with a particular DNS message, which might be usable in queries. However, it is possible that there might be a future requirement for one or more "meta-CLASSes".
contents.zh-CHS: 到目前为止，还没有对“元类”的要求。这将是一个类，用于指定与特定DNS消息关联的瞬态数据，这些数据可能在查询中可用。然而，未来可能需要一个或多个“元类”。

contents.text: CLASSes have mnemonics that must be completely disjoint from the mnemonics used for RRTYPEs and that must match the following regular expression:
contents.zh-CHS: 类的助记符必须与用于RRTYPE的助记符完全分离，并且必须与以下正则表达式匹配：

contents.text: The current CLASS assignments and considerations for future assignments are as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 目前的课堂作业和未来作业的注意事项如下：

contents.text: Decimal Hexadecimal
contents.zh-CHS: 十六进制

contents.text: 0 0x0000 - Reserved; assignment requires a Standards Action.
contents.zh-CHS: 0 0x0000-保留；分配需要标准操作。

contents.text: 1 0x0001 - Internet (IN).
2 0x0002 - Available for assignment by IETF Review as a data CLASS.
contents.zh-CHS: 2 0x0002-可作为数据类由IETF评审分配。

contents.text: 3 0x0003 - Chaos (CH) [Moon1981].
4 0x0004 - Hesiod (HS) [Dyer1987].
contents.zh-CHS: 4 0x0004-赫西奥德（HS）[Dyer1987]。

contents.text: 5 - 127 0x0005 - 0x007F - Available for assignment by IETF Review for data CLASSes only.
contents.zh-CHS: 5-127 0x0005-0x007F-仅适用于数据类的IETF评审分配。

contents.text: 128 - 253 0x0080 - 0x00FD - Available for assignment by IETF Review for QCLASSes and meta-CLASSes only.
contents.zh-CHS: 128-253 0x0080-0x00FD-仅适用于QCLASSes和meta类的IETF评审分配。

contents.text: 254 0x00FE - QCLASS NONE [RFC2136].
contents.zh-CHS: 254 0x00FE-QCLASS NONE[RFC2136]。

contents.text: 255 0x00FF - QCLASS * (ANY) [RFC1035].
contents.zh-CHS: 255 0x00FF-QCLASS*（任何）[RFC1035]。

contents.text: 256 - 32,767 0x0100 - 0x7FFF - Assigned by IETF Review.
contents.zh-CHS: 256-32767 0x0100-0x7FFF-由IETF评审分配。

contents.text: 32,768 - 57,343 0x8000 - 0xDFFF - Assigned for data CLASSes only, based on Specification Required as defined in [RFC5226].
contents.zh-CHS: 32768-57343 0x8000-0xDFFF-根据[RFC5226]中定义的规范，仅为数据类分配。

contents.text: 57,344 - 65,279 0xE000 - 0xFEFF - Assigned for QCLASSes and meta-CLASSes only, based on Specification Required as defined in [RFC5226].
contents.zh-CHS: 57344-65279 0xE000-0xFEFF-根据[RFC5226]中定义的规范，仅为QClass和meta类分配。

contents.text: 65,280 - 65,534 0xFF00 - 0xFFFE - Private Use.
contents.zh-CHS: 65280-65534 0xFF00-0xFFFE-私人使用。

contents.text: 65,535 0xFFFF - Reserved; can only be assigned by a Standards Action.
contents.zh-CHS: 65535 0xFFFF-预留；只能由标准操作指定。

contents.text: 3.3. Label Considerations
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3. 标签注意事项

contents.text: DNS NAMEs are sequences of labels [RFC1035].
contents.zh-CHS: DNS名称是标签序列[RFC1035]。

contents.text: 3.3.1. Label Types
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3.1. 标签类型

contents.text: At the present time, there are two categories of label types: data labels and compression labels. Compression labels are pointers to data labels elsewhere within an RR or DNS message and are intended to shorten the wire encoding of NAMEs.
contents.zh-CHS: 目前，有两类标签类型：数据标签和压缩标签。压缩标签是指向RR或DNS消息中其他位置的数据标签的指针，旨在缩短名称的有线编码。

contents.text: The two existing data label types are sometimes referred to as Text and Binary. Text labels can, in fact, include any octet value including zero-value octets, but many current uses involve only [US-ASCII]. For retrieval, Text labels are defined to treat ASCII upper and lower case letter codes as matching [RFC4343]. Binary labels are bit sequences [RFC2673]. The Binary label type is Experimental [RFC3363].
contents.zh-CHS: 现有的两种数据标签类型有时称为文本和二进制。事实上，文本标签可以包含任何八位字节值，包括零值八位字节，但当前的许多使用仅涉及[US-ASCII]。对于检索，文本标签被定义为将ASCII大写和小写字母代码视为匹配[RFC4343]。二进制标签是位序列[RFC2673]。二进制标签类型是实验性的[RFC3363]。

contents.text: IANA considerations for label types are given in [RFC2671].
contents.zh-CHS: [RFC2671]中给出了标签类型的IANA注意事项。

contents.text: 3.3.2. Label Contents and Use
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3.2. 标签内容和使用

contents.text: The last label in each NAME is "ROOT", which is the zero-length label. By definition, the null or ROOT label cannot be used for any other NAME purpose.
contents.zh-CHS: 每个名称中的最后一个标签是“根”，即零长度标签。根据定义，null或ROOT标签不能用于任何其他名称目的。

contents.text: NAMEs are local to a CLASS. The Hesiod [Dyer1987] and Chaos [Moon1981] CLASSes are for essentially local use. The IN, or Internet, CLASS is thus the only DNS CLASS in global use on the Internet at this time.
contents.zh-CHS: 名称是类的本地名称。Hesiod[Dyer1987]和Chaos[Moon1981]类基本上是本地使用的。因此，IN或Internet类是目前Internet上唯一一个全局使用的DNS类。

contents.text: A somewhat out-of-date description of name allocation in the IN Class is given in [RFC1591]. Some information on reserved top-level domain names is in BCP 32 [RFC2606].
contents.zh-CHS: [RFC1591]中给出了类内名称分配的过时描述。有关保留顶级域名的一些信息，请参见BCP 32[RFC2606]。

contents.text: 4. Security Considerations
contents.zh-CHS: 4. 安全考虑

contents.text: This document addresses IANA considerations in the allocation of general DNS parameters, not security. See [RFC4033], [RFC4034], and [RFC4035] for secure DNS considerations.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档介绍了IANA在分配通用DNS参数时的注意事项，而不是安全性。有关安全DNS注意事项，请参阅[RFC4033]、[RFC4034]和[RFC4035]。

contents.text: 5. IANA Considerations
contents.zh-CHS: 5. IANA考虑

contents.text: This document consists entirely of DNS IANA Considerations.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档完全包含DNS IANA注意事项。

contents.text: IANA has established a process for accepting Appendix A templates and selecting an Expert from those appointed to review such template form applications. IANA archives and makes available all approved RRTYPE allocation templates. It is the duty of the applicant to post the formal application template to the dns-rrtype-applications@ietf.org mailing list, which IANA will monitor. The dnsext@ietf.org mailing list is for community discussion and comment. See Section 3.1 and Appendix A for more details.
contents.zh-CHS: IANA已经建立了一个程序，用于接受附录a模板，并从指定的人员中选择一名专家来审查此类模板申请。IANA存档并提供所有批准的RRTYPE分配模板。申请人有责任将正式申请模板发布到dns rrtype-applications@ietf.orgIANA将监控的邮件列表。这个dnsext@ietf.org邮件列表用于社区讨论和评论。详见第3.1节和附录A。

contents.text: Appendix A. RRTYPE Allocation Template
contents.zh-CHS: 附录A.RRTYPE分配模板

contents.text: DNS RRTYPE PARAMETER ALLOCATION TEMPLATE
contents.zh-CHS: DNS RRTYPE参数分配模板

contents.text: When ready for formal consideration, this template is to be submitted to IANA for processing by emailing the template to dns-rrtype-applications@ietf.org.
contents.zh-CHS: 当准备正式考虑时，该模板将通过电子邮件发送至dns rrtype提交给IANA处理-applications@ietf.org.

contents.text: A. Submission Date:
contents.zh-CHS: A.提交日期：

contents.text: B. Submission Type: [ ] New RRTYPE [ ] Modification to existing RRTYPE
contents.zh-CHS: B.提交类型：[]新RRTYPE[]对现有RRTYPE的修改

contents.text: C. Contact Information for submitter (will be publicly posted): Name: Email Address: International telephone number: Other contact handles:
contents.zh-CHS: C.提交人的联系信息（将公开发布）：姓名：电子邮件地址：国际电话号码：其他联系方式：

contents.text: D. Motivation for the new RRTYPE application. Please keep this part at a high level to inform the Expert and reviewers about uses of the RRTYPE. Most reviewers will be DNS experts that may have limited knowledge of your application space.
contents.zh-CHS: D.新RRTYPE应用的动机。请将此部分保持在较高水平，以告知专家和审查人员RRTYPE的使用情况。大多数审阅者将是DNS专家，他们可能对您的应用程序空间了解有限。

contents.text: E. Description of the proposed RR type. This description can be provided in-line in the template, as an attachment, or with a publicly available URL.
contents.zh-CHS: E.建议RR类型的说明。此描述可以在模板中联机提供、作为附件提供或使用公开可用的URL提供。

contents.text: F. What existing RRTYPE or RRTYPEs come closest to filling that need and why are they unsatisfactory?
contents.zh-CHS: F.哪些现有的RRTYPE或RRTYPE最接近满足该需求，为什么它们不令人满意？

contents.text: G. What mnemonic is requested for the new RRTYPE (optional)? Note: this can be left blank and the mnemonic decided after the template is accepted.
contents.zh-CHS: G.新RRTYPE需要什么助记符（可选）？注意：这可以留空，并且在接受模板后决定助记符。

contents.text: H. Does the requested RRTYPE make use of any existing IANA registry or require the creation of a new IANA sub-registry in DNS Parameters? If so, please indicate which registry is to be used or created. If a new sub-registry is needed, specify the allocation policy for it and its initial contents. Also include what the modification procedures will be.
contents.zh-CHS: H.请求的RRTYPE是否使用了任何现有的IANA注册表或要求在DNS参数中创建新的IANA子注册表？如果是，请说明将使用或创建哪个注册表。如果需要新的子注册表，请指定其分配策略及其初始内容。还包括修改程序。

contents.text: I. Does the proposal require/expect any changes in DNS servers/resolvers that prevent the new type from being processed as an unknown RRTYPE (see [RFC3597])?
contents.zh-CHS: I.提案是否要求/预期DNS服务器/解析程序中的任何更改，以防止将新类型作为未知RRTYPE处理（请参见[RFC3597]）？

contents.text: J. Comments:
contents.zh-CHS: J.评论：

contents.text: Appendix B. Changes From RFC 5395
contents.zh-CHS: 附录B.RFC 5395的变更

contents.text: Replaced "namedroppers@ops.ietf.org" with "dnsext@ietf.org".
contents.zh-CHS: 取代“namedroppers@ops.ietf.org“与”dnsext@ietf.org".

contents.text: Dropped description of changes from RFC 2929 to RFC 5395 since those changes have already happened, and we don't need to do them again.
contents.zh-CHS: 删除了从RFC 2929到RFC 5395的更改描述，因为这些更改已经发生，我们不需要再次执行。

contents.text: Updated the boilerplate text.
contents.zh-CHS: 更新了样板文本。

contents.text: Fixed Section 5 to say that it is the duty of the applicant, not the expert, to post the application to dns-rrtype-applications@ietf.org.
contents.zh-CHS: 修正了第5节，即申请人而非专家有责任将申请发布到dns rrtype-applications@ietf.org.

contents.text: Changed the regular expression for RRTYPE and CLASS names so as to prohibit trailing hyphen ("-") and require a minimum length of 2 characters.
contents.zh-CHS: 更改了RRTYPE和类名的正则表达式，以禁止尾随连字符（“-”），并要求最小长度为2个字符。

contents.text: Made a number of minor editorial and typos fixes.
contents.zh-CHS: 做了一些小的编辑和排版修正。

contents.text: Normative References
contents.zh-CHS: 规范性引用文件

contents.zh-CHS: [RFC1034]Mockapetris，P.，“域名-概念和设施”，STD 13，RFC 1034，1987年11月。

contents.zh-CHS: [RFC1035]Mockapetris，P.，“域名-实现和规范”，STD 13，RFC 1035，1987年11月。

contents.zh-CHS: [RFC2845]Vixie，P.，Gudmundsson，O.，Eastlake 3rd，D.，和B.Wellington，“DNS秘密密钥交易认证（TSIG）”，RFC 28452000年5月。

contents.text: [RFC3425] Lawrence, D., "Obsoleting IQUERY", RFC 3425, November 2002.
contents.zh-CHS: [RFC3425]劳伦斯，D.，“淘汰液体”，RFC 34252002年11月。

contents.zh-CHS: [RFC4635]Eastlake 3rd，D.，“HMAC SHA（哈希消息认证码，安全哈希算法）TSIG算法标识符”，RFC 4635，2006年8月。

contents.zh-CHS: [US-ASCII]ANSI，“美国信息交换标准代码”，X3.4，美国国家标准协会：纽约，1968年。

contents.text: Informative References
contents.zh-CHS: 资料性引用

contents.text: [Dyer1987] Dyer, S., and F. Hsu, "Hesiod", Project Athena Technical Plan - Name Service, April 1987.
contents.zh-CHS: [Dyer1987]Dyer，S.和F.Hsu，“赫西奥德”，雅典娜项目技术计划-名称服务，1987年4月。

contents.text: [Moon1981] Moon, D., "Chaosnet", A.I. Memo 628, Massachusetts Institute of Technology Artificial Intelligence Laboratory, June 1981.
contents.zh-CHS: [Moon1981]Moon，D.，“Chaosnet”，A.I.备忘录628，麻省理工学院人工智能实验室，1981年6月。

contents.text: [RFC1183] Everhart, C., Mamakos, L., Ullmann, R., and P. Mockapetris, "New DNS RR Definitions", RFC 1183, October 1990.
